results.title: Garden watering systems
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Do It Yourself Home Video Workshop. Series 1”.
Instructional video that advises the viewer on designing and installing a watering system specifically for their home. It suggests tool and material requirements, offers measurement and design advice and demonstrates the installation of drip, pop-up lawn, garden-bed and automatic watering systems. It also offers some general watering tips.

results.title: Garden plants and how they grow
results.brief_description: Illustrates general principles of plant growth. Examines the interior of a seed; distinguishes plants which store food in their stems, leaves, roots and seed pods; compares plants grown in good and poor soil and in sunlight and shade; shows destructive animals and insects and those which are helpful to plants. Time-lapse photography is used to show the growth of bean seeds.

results.title: Garden party
results.creator_credit: ACI Films, Paul R. Gurian and Jack Sholder
results.brief_description: An adaptation of a short story by Katherine Mansfield, presenting a story about a garden party which continues uninterrupted by a neighbourhood death. Helps stimulate discussion on the meaning of death. A sensitive approach to a difficult theme. It is recommended that teachers preview this film before screening.

results.title: Garden of the great spirit
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Amaranth Productions, Barry Gray and Gary Johnson
results.brief_description: The St Lawrence Islands National Park, located in the Thousand Islands, Ontario, is an area of great natural beauty and historic interest. Geography and weather have created a greater variety of plant life here than anywhere ales in Canada. The film points out the park’s main features while reminding the audience that conservation must be practised to protect the fragile balance of nature. Narrated by Cy Stranger, camera by David M. Ostricker.

results.title: Garden of Eden
results.brief_description: Overall winner of the 2002 ACMI Infogrames Diegesis, Garden of Eden was described by the judges as ‘aesthetically mature’ and ‘conceptually rich, reminiscent of the brothers Quay’. The filmmaker was attempting to explore the theme of ‘nature versus religion’ and this rather dark vision features mesmorising characters that occupy a surreal landscape with a haunting original soundtrack of strings.

results.title: Garden Australia (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Hosted by Graham and Sandra Ross this video is a collection of helpful and practical hints for the home gardener, taken from their popular weekly TV series. The video is divided into four segments: The vegetable garden, The flower garden, Australian natives and a miscellaneous section which includes hanging baskets, terrariums, lawns and fruit fly control.

results.title: Garden = Jardin
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Christopher Nutter
results.brief_description: A film animation experiment in metaphoric imagery. This is a surrealistic garden where the earth seethes with strange, unusual shapes and activity, accelerated in movement, compressed in time. Insect-like creatures dart under and over the sand with elusive swiftness; Picasso-like faces stare momentarily upward, mutate, and disappear; wilted blossoms become suddenly animated. What happens on the screen is punctuated and accompanied by synthetic sound effects. Music by Bruce Mackay.
